page.title: 08 LOCAL FARMING
page.content: Most of our 12 km/sq block is,in one way or another as farmland.As the land slopes up from the Kelvin Valley to the tops of the Kilsyth Hills,so the land is used for different types of farming. The lower slopes are more fertile, and are used mainly as rich pasture for dairy cows and sheep.Some of this land is also used to grow cereal crops (eg corn,barley) and vegetables(eg potatoes,turnips).Fodder crops are also grown. The upper slopes is mostly marshland and is used for herding the sheep and returning the sheep back to the pens. There are five farms in our block and they all have animals and crops because most of the farms are quite large.
